titleInfo.title: Front view, State Penitentiary at Baton Rouge.

mods.note: 'Lytle Studio appears to have begun contract photography work around 1900This series of images created in Louisiana State prison facilities, ca1900, documents the physical plant and social conditions in these institutionsFrom 1869 until 1900, the Louisiana State Penitentiary system was operated under a private lease to Major SLJamesConditions under his oversight were brutal at best, fatal at worst In 1900, the system was completely overhauled, the lease bought from the heirs of Major James, and a new state board took control effective October 1, 1900That new board's 1901 annual report, published in 1902, was illustrated with halftone reproductions of Lytle photographsThis is an exterior view of the state penitentiary from the street, ca1900The penitentiary was located in Baton Rouge between Florida and Laurel Streets, running from Seventh to Tenth.' Mark EMartin, in Andrew DLytleâ€™s Baton Rouge: photographs 1863-1910, (Baton Rouge, LSU Press, 2008), p33See, "Board of Control State Penitentiary Report," HV 8338 A2, 1901, page 16a.

titleInfo.title: Andrew DLytle's Baton Rouge' Photograph Collection/

mods.accessCondition: Physical rights are retained by the LSU LibrariesCopyright of the original material is retained in accordance with U.Scopyright lawsPermission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Division, Louisiana State University Libraries.
Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.
mods.note: Henry LFuqua, JrLytle Photograph Collection and Papers, Mss1898, Louisiana and Lower Mississippi Valley Collections, LSU Libraries, Baton Rouge, La.
